intro: Salmeopsis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a contrasting purple or brown throat. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and rockeries.
